Legal_Issue: Did the Board err in failing to consider relevant evidence regarding the safety of openly gay men in Mexico City?
Application_Facts: Mr. Garcia's refugee claim was rejected based on an alleged safe internal flight alternative in Mexico City.
Decision_Outcome: The application for judicial review is allowed, and the case is remitted for redetermination by a different panel.
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Board's decision
Court_Ruling: The court found the Board erred and ordered a new hearing with a different panel.
Defendant_Behavior: The Board ignored a 1998 report showing violent crimes against gay men in Mexico City, focusing instead on recent tolerance indicators.
Grounds_for_Claim: Risk of persecution due to sexual orientation in Mexico
Legal_Standard: The Board must analyze and explain contradictory evidence on central issues, especially when it impacts factual findings.
Assessment_Factor: Safety of openly gay men in Mexico City
Procedural_Issue: Whether the Board properly considered all evidence before rejecting the claim
Review_Standard: Reasonableness or correctness (implied by judicial review context)
Evidence_Used: 1998 report on violent crimes against gay men in Mexico City
Recent indicators of tolerance in Mexico City
Application_Basis: Safe internal flight alternative in Mexico City
Evidence_Assessed: Contradictory evidence on safety conditions for gay men in Mexico City

Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to address the 1998 report on violence against gay men
Outcome: Judicial review allowed; case remitted for redetermination
Harm_Assessment: Risk of harm due to sexual orientation if returned to Mexico
Cause_Description: Mr. Garcia's refugee claim was rejected based on an alleged safe internal flight alternative in Mexico City.
Evidence_Handling: The Board focused on recent tolerance indicators while ignoring a 1998 report on violence against gay men.
